meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irreversible.
meanings.sent1: The irreversibility of the decision left us with no other choice.
meanings.sent2: The irreversibility of time passing is a constant in life.
meanings.sent3: The irreversibility of the glue made the art project a one-time deal.
meanings.sent4: The irreversibility of the damage to the painting was heartbreaking.
meanings.sent5: The irreversibility of the rule made it impossible to change.

meanings.definition: The inability to be reversed or undone.
meanings.sent1: The irreversibility of the contract meant we had to follow through.
meanings.sent2: The irreversibility of the mistake made it hard to fix.
meanings.sent3: The irreversibility of the prank made it unforgettable.
meanings.sent4: The irreversibility of the decision weighed heavily on her mind.
meanings.sent5: The irreversibility of the injury changed his life forever.
